channel.title: Packets?
channel.description: What are they? How do they work? How do you add them? How do you find them?

item.title: Packets?
item.dc:creator: @X_F_U_R_Y_X X F U R Y X
item.description:
@X_F_U_R_Y_X wrote:

[quote=“Lin, post:8, topic:284311”]A packet is basically a group of data. I can elaborate a lot more on this, but that’s what you can think of it as.

Since you want to know what they are for RSPS, they carry information over to each other, to which they then process the data.

Each packet has its own ID. How the server or client handles it depends on the ID. After that is the data the packet carried. For example, if you wanted to send a message, you’d send to the client that you’re creating a message, and then send the actual message afterwords.[/quote]
Okay, I see, thanks.

So could you exemplify on how to use a send message packet to make the server send a specific message? The packet ID doesn’t matter, just how would you use it?

I would imagine you would need a void method to execute the packet, then you would need to send the packet in to process, how would you create a value (the text sent) to go along with the packet?

[quote=“jman7, post:9, topic:284311”]heres some terms lol. these are part of packets.

Important Methods of the List Object:

VOID: clear(); //removes everything from the list

BOOLEAN: add(Object o); //adds the specific object to the list (returns true if the object was added)

BOOLEAN: contains(Object o); //returns true if the specific object is in the list

BOOLEAN: remove(Object o); //removes the specific object from the list (returns true if the object was removed)

Glossary:

import: Allows us to use certain classes without having to add the code for it within each of our files.

String: Used to hold information.

int: Used to hold the value of something.

void: A keyword used in Java to indicate a method does not return a value.

sM: Used to send a message to the players client.

and some links that might help
http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,290166.0.html
http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,290166.0.html <— has adding classes
http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,355458.0.html seperate file for your packets
http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,364386.0.html learning about variables[/quote]
Thanks, but none of the definitions were on packets, and unfortunately I knew all the rest. I’ll be looking into the links that you posted, thanks a ton.

Read full topic

item.title: Packets?
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

A packet is basically a group of data. I can elaborate a lot more on this, but that’s what you can think of it as.

Since you want to know what they are for RSPS, they carry information over to each other, to which they then process the data.

Each packet has its own ID. How the server or client handles it depends on the ID. After that is the data the packet carried. For example, if you wanted to send a message, you’d send to the client that you’re creating a message, and then send the actual message afterwords.

Read full topic

And yes, I would hope to learn what they are, and that is why I’m asking.

Thanks for trying though.
